intro: Lundia intermedia, commonly known as the intermediate lundia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to parts of Africa and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Lundia intermedia thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
